page.title: 02MODERN KIRBY
page.content: The area is rather flat, and slopes gently to the coast and a large area made up of many small islands and extensive mud flats. The largest island, Horsey Island, is private, and can be approached at low tide by a causeway. This area contains the oldest buildings in Kirby, many of them dating from the 15th century. There is a small boatyard and launching area which used to be a thriving quay before the river silted up and motor transport became popular. One unusual feature is the free supply of soft spring water to a number of taps along the road.The water comes from a spring on private land.It was inaugurated by a local landowner as a gift to the village.
